CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 8, 1962, pg. 30 reads: "Reward For Service - A highlight of the annual Awards Dinner, last Sunday, at the Kay Boys' Club, was the presentation of certificates of merit to members of the Kay Women's Auxiliary, who have served for ten years or more. Organized by Mrs. Margaret Lampkin in 1943, honorees, with Wilhelmina Gray Cooper, who contributed her sponsors' products to the dinner, are (left to right): Mmes. Mattie Hall, Thelma Childress, Alma Tucker, Rose King, New York; Margaret Lampkin, Wilhelmina, Elizabeth Straider, Coretta Ogburn, representing her sister, Ardell Washington of New York; Viola McCoy, and Allie Armstrong for Lillian Twyman. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of members of Kay Women's Auxiliary: Mattie Hall, Thelma Childress, Alma Tucker, Rose King, Elizabeth Straider, Coretta Ogburn, Ardell Washington, Viola McCoy, and Allie Armstrong, holding certificates of merit, posed in Kay Boy's Club during annual Awards Dinner
